summary: The Department of Defense has received more than $1.8 trillion for war-related activities since 2001. Currently, Congress provides funds for both war-related activities and regular activities. DOD tracks the funds separately by using codes in its financial system. We identified more ways to separate these funds: Move costs that will endure beyond current war operations to the regular budget Use language in the appropriations acts...
title: Overseas Contingency Operations: Alternatives Identified to the Approach to Fund War- Related Activities
